CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Margarita Tsatsa-Nikolovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Snejana Botoucharova;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . A private company sued the applicant on a claim of unjust enrichment not related to his salary . It submitted a document showing that the applicant had received money from the company . The applicant counterclaimed that the document had been void .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claim , partly allowed the company ’s claim and ordered that the applicant repay MONEY ( RUB ) to the company .
CARDINAL . By a supplementary judgment of DATE , ORG ordered that the applicant pay the court fee of RUB CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the judgments and remitted the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s claim . It declared the voucher void , confirmed the applicant ’s title to the disputed money , ordered that the company pay the applicant RUB CARDINAL in legal costs and expenses and ordered that the applicant pay the company RUB CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . In its grounds of appeal the company complained that the first - instance and appeal courts had erred in the establishment of the facts .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG reversed the award of RUB CARDINAL , rejected the company ’s claims in full , and upheld the remainder of the judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the company filed an application for supervisory review of the judgments of DATE and DATE . It reiterated its argument that that the first - instance and appeal courts had erred in the establishment of the facts and asked the ORG of ORG to quash their judgments and to remit the case to the first - instance court .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed comments on the application for supervisory review . He maintained his claims and asked the Presidium of ORG to reject the application .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG quashed the judgments of DATE , DATE and DATE because the courts had incorrectly established the facts . It reinstated the judgment of DATE . Counsel for the applicant was present at the hearing .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant repaid RUB CARDINAL to the company .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave a binding interpretation of the provisions governing legal fee agreements . It indicated , inter alia , that contingency fee agreements were not enforceable . On DATE the ORG confirmed that approach .
